reference: Benefits for several programs will end in nine days if the budget does not pass, but what are the Conservatives doing?
mt: The benefits of a number of programs will end in nine days if the budget is not passed, but what are the Conservatives doing?

source: Monsieur le Président, mon collègue, lui, peut-il me dire quand les conservateurs vont arrêter de bloquer le budget?
reference: Mr. Speaker, can my colleague tell me when the Conservatives will stop blocking the budget?
mt: Mr. Speaker, can my colleague tell me when the Conservatives will stop blocking the budget?

source: Quand est-ce qu'ils vont arrêter de bloquer ces projets progressistes et quand est-ce que le Bloc québécois et le NPD vont arrêter d'appuyer les conservateurs dans ce processus afin de nous aider et d'aider l'ensemble des Canadiens?
reference: When will they stop blocking these progressive bills, and when will the Bloc Québécois and the NDP stop supporting the Conservatives' antics and start helping us and all Canadians?
mt: When will they stop blocking these progressive projects and when will the Bloc Québécois and the NDP stop supporting the Conservatives in this process in order to help us and all Canadians?

source: Monsieur le Président, sans la vigilance des médias et du Parti conservateur, le <Affiliation DbId="214296" Type="1">premier ministre</Affiliation> aurait laissé le Parti communiste chinois s'infiltrer dans nos ambassades de partout au monde, par l'intermédiaire de la compagnie Nuctech, qui installait des appareils à rayons X. Or nous l'avons convaincu qu'il s'agissait d'une erreur, et il a annulé le contrat.
reference: Mr. Speaker, if the media and the Conservative Party had not been so vigilant, the <Affiliation DbId="214296" Type="1">Prime Minister</Affiliation> would have allowed the Chinese Communist Party to infiltrate our embassies around the world through the company Nuctech, which installed X-ray machines. We managed to convince him that it was a mistake, and he cancelled the contract.
mt: Mr. Speaker, without the attention of the media and the Conservative Party, the <Affiliation DbId="214296" Type="1"> Prime Minister</Affiliation> would have allowed the Chinese Communist Party to infiltrate our embassies around the world through Nuctech, which installed X-ray planes, but we convinced him that it was a mistake, and he cancelled the contract.

source: Que cette Chambre, reconnaissant l'importance de la vérité historique dans le processus de guérison des familles et des nations éplorées, exige que le gouvernement déploie au bénéfice des communautés autochtones les ressources financières nécessaires à la réalisation de tous les appels de la Commission de Vérité et Réconciliation afin que les communautés autochtones puissent disposer des moyens techniques et scientifiques et de la maîtrise d'œuvre nécessaires à l'identification des sites, à la mise en place des registres, ainsi qu'à la recherche historique et à la commémoration des victimes;
reference: That the House, recognizing the importance of historical truth in the process of healing grieving families and nations, insist that the government deploy, for the benefit of indigenous communities, the financial resources necessary to carry out every call to action in the Truth and Reconciliation Commission in order for indigenous communities to have the technical and scientific means and the project management necessary for the identification of sites and the establishment of registers, as well as for historical research and the commemoration of the victims;
mt: That this House, recognizing the importance of the historical truth in the healing process for grieving families and nations, demand that the government provide aboriginal communities with the financial resources they need to carry out all of the appeals of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission so that Aboriginal communities can have the technical, scientific and mastery of work necessary to identify the sites, implement the records, and provide historical research and commemoration of the victims;

source: Que cette Chambre, reconnaissant qu'Ottawa est située sur le territoire traditionnel du peuple Algonquin et agissant en conséquence, affirme qu'il est urgent que l'appel à l'action numéro 82 de la Commission de Vérité et Réconciliation prévoyant la construction d'un monument national sur les pensionnats soit érigé à Ottawa et réitère qu'il est essentiel que les organisations nationales autochtones reconnues soient parties prenantes du processus comme il se doit et enfin;
reference: That the House recognize that Ottawa is located on the traditional territory of the Algonquin people and, acting accordingly, affirm that it is urgent that call to action number 82 of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission, providing for the construction of a national monument to residential schools, be erected in Ottawa and reiterate that it is essential that all recognized national indigenous organizations be involved in the process, as they should; and finally,
mt: That this House, recognizing that Ottawa is located on the traditional territory of the Algonquin people and acting accordingly, affirm that it is urgent that call to action number 82 of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission to establish a national residential school monument be located in Ottawa and reiterate that it is essential that recognized national aboriginal organizations be involved in the process as they should and finally;

source: Le gouvernement est disposé à produire les documents non caviardés au légiste et conseiller parlementaire, si la Chambre des communes accepte que des spécialistes de la sécurité nationale lui viennent en aide et que d'autres mesures de sécurité appropriées soient mises en place.
reference: The government is open to providing the unredacted documents to the Law Clerk and Parliamentary Counsel if the House of Commons agrees that national security specialists can assist him in this process and that other appropriate safeguards be put in place.
mt: The government is prepared to provide the unredacted documents to the Law Clerk and Parliamentary Counsel if the House of Commons agrees that national security specialists will assist it and that other appropriate security measures are in place.

source: Elle a été votée à la majorité de la Chambre des communes par tous les partis de l'opposition.
reference: The majority of the House of Commons, all of the opposition parties, voted in favour of it.
mt: It was voted on by a majority of the House of Commons by all opposition parties.

source: M. Stewart a reçu l'ordre de se présenter à la barre, à la Chambre, pendant cette séance, « [...] afin qu'il remette les documents dont la Chambre a ordonné la production le 2 juin 2021, pour qu'ils puissent être déposés auprès du légiste et du conseiller parlementaire conformément à cet ordre. »
reference: Mr. Stewart received the order to attend at the bar of the House this day for the purposes of “delivering up the documents ordered by the House, on June 2, 2021, to be produced, so that they may be deposited with the Law Clerk and Parliamentary Counsel under the terms of that order”.
mt: Mr. Stewart was ordered to appear at the bar in the House during that sitting, “...to submit the documents ordered by the House on June 2, 2021, so that they may be deposited with the Law Clerk and Parliamentary Counsel pursuant to this order.”

source: ORDRES ÉMANANT DU GOUVERNEMENT
reference: GOVERNMENT ORDERS
mt: GOVERNMENT ORDERS

source: Ordres émanant du gouvernement
reference: Government Orders
mt: Government Orders

source: Madame la Présidente, j'ai l'impression que, en ce moment, le Parti conservateur, sous l'influence de sa droite religieuse, cherche des excuses.
reference: Madam Speaker, I sense that, at this time, the Conservative Party is being influenced by its religious right wing and is looking for excuses.
mt: Madam Speaker, it seems to me that right now the Conservative Party, under the influence of its religious right, is looking for an apology.

source: Les conservateurs disent être contre les thérapies de conversion, mais ils ne veulent pas voter en faveur de leur interdiction.
reference: The Conservatives say they are against conversion therapy, but they do not want to vote to ban it.
mt: The Conservatives say they are against conversion therapy, but they do not want to vote in favour of banning conversion therapy.

source: N'est-ce pas là le malaise du Parti conservateur en ce moment?
reference: Is that not what is making the Conservative Party uneasy at this time?
mt: Is that not the discomfort of the Conservative Party right now?

source: Si un député d'un parti reconnu présent à la Chambre désire demander un vote par appel nominal ou que la motion soit adoptée avec dissidence, je l'invite à se lever et à l'indiquer à la présidence.
reference: If a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.
mt: If a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.

source: Conformément à l'ordre adopté le lundi 25 janvier, le vote par appel nominal est différé jusqu'au mardi 22 juin, à la fin de la période prévue pour les questions orales.
reference: Pursuant to order made on Monday, January 25, the recorded division stands deferred until Tuesday, June 22 at the expiry of the time provided for Oral Questions.
mt: Pursuant to order made on Monday, January 25, the division stands deferred until Tuesday, June 22, at the expiry of the time provided for Oral Questions.

source: Les fonctionnaires très indépendants et très compétents du ministère de la Justice ont témoigné devant le Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien.
reference: The Department of Justice's highly independent and competent officials testified before the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage.
mt: The very independent and very capable public servants at the Department of Justice testified before the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage.

source: Madame la Présidente, l'attribution de temps est rarement acceptable.
reference: Madam Speaker, time allocation is rarely acceptable.
mt: Madam Speaker, time allocation is rarely acceptable.

source: Le Bloc québécois va appuyer cette motion d'attribution de temps pour, justement, que les géants du Web apportent leur juste contribution à nos créateurs qui se sont souvent fait spolier par ces géants.
reference: The Bloc Québécois will support this time allocation motion to make web giants pay their fair share to our creators, who have often been taken advantage of by these giants.
mt: The Bloc Québécois will support this time allocation motion to ensure that web giants contribute their fair share to our creators, who have often been polited by these giants.

source: De plus, dès que le projet de loi C‑10 a été déposé, le Parti conservateur s'y est opposé en disant qu'il n'était pas bon, qu'il fallait le jeter et tout recommencer.
reference: Furthermore, as soon as Bill C‑10 was introduced, the Conservative Party objected to it, said the bill was bad and should be scrapped, and told us to start over.
mt: Furthermore, as soon as Bill C-10 was introduced, the Conservative Party opposed it and said that it was not good, that we had to throw it all over again.

source: <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">L’hon. Steven Guilbeault (ministre du Patrimoine canadien, Lib.) </Affiliation>
reference: <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">Hon. Steven Guilbeault (Minister of Canadian Heritage, Lib.) </Affiliation>
mt: <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4"> Hon. Steven Guilbeault (Minister of Canadian Heritage, Lib.) </Affiliation>

source: L'histoire a débuté en novembre dernier, lorsque le <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">ministre du Patrimoine canadien</Affiliation> a présenté à la Chambre un mauvais projet de loi.
reference: The story began last November, when the <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">Minister of Canadian Heritage</Affiliation> introduced a bad bill in the House.
mt: The story began in November when the <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4"> Minister of Canadian Heritage</Affiliation> introduced a bad bill in the House.

source: Pour les gens qui ne le savent pas, le Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien a même accepté à l'unanimité de faire un précomité pour ne pas ralentir le processus au début.
reference: Some people may not know this, but the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage even unanimously agreed to form a pre-committee so as not to slow down the process at the beginning.
mt: For those who do not know, the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage even unanimously agreed to avoid slowing down the process at the beginning.

source: Le ministre et ses députés libéraux en comité ont tout fait pour empêcher le <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">ministre du Patrimoine canadien</Affiliation> et le <Affiliation DbId="245291" Type="4">ministre de la Justice</Affiliation> de venir témoigner au Comité pour expliquer la raison pour laquelle ils voulaient retirer l'article 4.1.
reference: The minister and his Liberal members on the committee did everything they could to stop the <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">Minister of Canadian Heritage</Affiliation> and the <Affiliation DbId="245291" Type="4">Minister of Justice</Affiliation> from testifying in committee and explaining why they wanted to withdraw clause 4.1.
mt: The minister and his Liberal members at committee did everything they could to prevent the <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4"> Minister of Canadian Heritage</Affiliation> and the <Affiliation DbId="245291" Type="4"> Minister of Justice</Affiliation> from appearing before the committee to explain why they wanted to remove clause 4.1.

source: Les membres du Comité, à l'exclusion de ceux du Parti conservateur, ont décidé d’infirmer la décision du président du Comité, qui ne faisait que rapporter les propos du Président de la Chambre, disant qu'il faudrait voter en faveur du projet de loi sans même lire la quarantaine d'amendements qui manquaient.
reference: The committee members, apart from those belonging to the Conservative Party, decided to reverse the decision of the committee chair, who was only reporting what the Speaker of the House had said, that members would have to vote in favour of the bill without even reading the 40-some amendments that were missing.
mt: The members of the committee, excluding those of the Conservative Party, decided to overrule the chair of the committee, who was simply quoting the Speaker of the House, saying that we should vote in favour of the bill without even reading the 40 or so amendments that were missing.

source: Pourtant, même des députés du Parti vert et du NPD ont dénoncé certaines de ces façons de faire du gouvernement, lequel, à l'approche d'une élection prévue à l'automne, on le sait tous, a voulu jouer les gros bras.
reference: Even members of the Green Party and the NDP spoke out against some of these tactics by the government, which, as we all know, with an election coming up in the fall, wants to play tough.
mt: However, even members of the Green Party and the NDP have criticized some of the government's ways of doing things, which, as we all know, as we approach an election in the fall, wanted to play big games.

source: Madame la Présidente, je remercie ma collègue qui siège avec moi au Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien et qui travaille très fort, comme nous tous.
reference: Madam Speaker, I thank my colleague who sits with me on the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage and who works very hard, as we all do.
mt: Madam Speaker, I thank my colleague who sits with me on the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage and works very hard, as we all do.

source: Je dirai toutefois que les conservateurs vont toujours se battre pour la liberté d'expression non seulement pour les Canadiens et les Canadiennes, mais aussi pour nos artistes qui souhaitent avoir la liberté de pouvoir écrire les chansons, de faire les discours qu'ils souhaitent et de faire les bons spectacles d'humour que nous connaissons tous.
reference: I will say, however, that the Conservatives will always fight for freedom of expression, not only for Canadians but also for our artists who want to have the freedom to write songs, say the things they want to say and put on the quality comedy shows that we all know.
mt: However, I will say that the Conservatives will always fight for freedom of expression, not only for Canadians, but also for our artists who want the freedom to write songs, to make the speeches they want and to perform the kind of humour we all know.

source: Comme on a une loi au pays qui dit que les élections ont lieu tous les quatre ans et qu'au moins deux partis de l'opposition ont dit qu'ils ne voulaient pas d'élections en temps de pandémie, pourquoi le gouvernement libéral utilise-t-il un bâillon sans précédent dans l'histoire canadienne avec une procédure d'urgence sur ce projet de loi s'il n'est pas en train de nous indiquer qu'il veut déclencher des élections en automne?
reference: Since we have a law in this country that says that elections take place every four years and at least two opposition parties have said that they do not want an election in the midst of a pandemic, why is the Liberal government using a gag order that is unprecedented in the history of Canada and an emergency procedure on this bill if it is not trying to indicate that it wants a fall election?
mt: Since we have a law in this country that says that elections are held every four years and that at least two opposition parties have said that they do not want an election during a pandemic, why is the Liberal government using an unprecedented gag order in Canadian history with an emergency procedure on this bill if it is not telling us that it wants to call an election in the fall?

source: Si un député d'un parti reconnu présent à la Chambre désire demander un vote par appel nominal ou que la motion soit adoptée avec dissidence, je l'invite à se lever et à l'indiquer à la présidence.
reference: If a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.
mt: If a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.

mt: If a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.

mt: If a member of a recognized party in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.

reference: If a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I would invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.
mt: If a member recognized in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.

source: Madame la Présidente, je demande un vote par appel nominal.
reference: Madam Speaker, I request a recorded division.
mt: Madam Speaker, I request a recorded division.

source: Le vote par appel nominal sur la motion est différé.
reference: The recorded division on the motion stands deferred.
mt: The recorded division on the motion stands deferred.

source: Madame la Présidente, je demande un vote par appel nominal.
reference: Madam Speaker, I request a recorded division.
mt: Madam Speaker, I request a recorded division.

source: Le vote par appel nominal sur la motion est différé.
reference: The recorded division on the motion stands deferred.
mt: The recorded division on the motion stands deferred.

source: Monsieur le Président, le Parti conservateur est d'accord pour que le résultat du vote précédent s'applique, et il votera pour la motion.
reference: Mr. Speaker, we would agree to apply the vote, and Conservative members will be supporting.
mt: Mr. Speaker, the Conservative Party agrees to apply and will be voting in favour of the motion.

source: Monsieur le Président, nous sommes d'accord pour appliquer le résultat du vote précédent, et les députés conservateurs votent oui.
reference: Mr. Speaker, we agree to apply the vote, and Conservative members will be voting yes.
mt: Mr. Speaker, we agree to apply and Conservative members vote yes.

source: Monsieur le Président, les députés conservateurs sont d'accord pour appliquer les résultats du vote et voteront contre la motion.
reference: Mr. Speaker, Conservative members agree to apply the vote and will vote against the motion.
mt: Mr. Speaker, Conservative members agree to apply the vote and will be voting no.

source: Monsieur le Président, nous sommes d'accord pour appliquer le résultat du vote précédent, et les députés conservateurs votent contre la motion.
reference: Mr. Speaker, we agree to apply the vote, and the Conservative members will be voting against the motion.
mt: Mr. Speaker, we agree to apply the vote, and the Conservative members are voting against the motion.

source: Conformément à l'ordre adopté plus tôt, un député de chaque parti reconnu et un député du Parti vert peuvent prendre la parole sur la motion pendant au plus dix minutes, suivies de cinq minutes de questions et d'observations.
reference: Pursuant to an order made earlier today, a member of each recognized party and a member of the Green Party will each be allowed to speak for not more than 10 minutes followed by five minutes for questions and comments.
mt: Pursuant to order made earlier, a member from each recognized party and a member of the Green Party may speak to the motion for not more than 10 minutes, followed by five minutes of questions and comments.

source: Je salue les membres du Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien qui ont travaillé fort depuis le dépôt du projet de loi <Document DbId="10926636" Type="3">C‑10</Document>.
reference: I commend the members of the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage who have been working hard since Bill <Document DbId="10926636" Type="3">C‑10</Document> was introduced.
mt: I commend the members of the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage who have worked hard since Bill <Document DbId="10926636" Type="3"> C-10</Document> was introduced.

source: Les seuls qui en auront tiré profit, ce sont les conservateurs, qui se sont opposés au projet de loi, malgré le fait que les autres partis de la Chambre travaillaient fort pour le faire avancer et pour l'améliorer.
reference: The only ones to profit from it are the Conservatives, who oppose the bill, despite the fact that the other parties of the House are working hard to improve it and move it forward.
mt: The only ones who have benefited are the Conservatives, who opposed the bill, despite the fact that the other parties in the House were working hard to move it forward and improve it.

source: Il est membre du Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien et, à chaque test de son — obligatoire avant les réunions des comités —, il le fait en français et partage donc avec nous l'évolution de ses leçons.
reference: He is a member of the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage, and every time we do a sound check, which is mandatory before committee meetings, he does his in French, which is his way of sharing what he has been learning.
mt: He is a member of the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage and, at every test of his own—mandatory before committee meetings—he does so in French and therefore shares his lessons with us.

source: Elle a fait un travail magistral et formidable au Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien sur le projet de loi <Document DbId="10926636" Type="3">C‑10</Document>, son adjointe, Mme Laveza Khan, a également travaillé extrêmement fort là-dessus, ainsi que mon adjoint Samuel Fortin-Pouliot qui, lui aussi, a travaillé très fort.
reference: She did a masterful job on Bill <Document DbId="10926636" Type="3">C‑10</Document> at the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage. Her assistant, Laveza Khan, also worked very hard on it, and my assistant Samuel Fortin-Pouliot worked very hard too.
mt: She did a fantastic job at the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage on Bill <Document DbId="10926636" Type="3"> C-10</Document> , and her assistant, Ms. Laveza Khan, also worked extremely hard on this, as well as my assistant, Samuel Fortin-Pouliot, who also worked very hard.

source: Nous étions d'accord sur les grandes orientations du rapport Yale, en tant que progressistes et néo-démocrates.
reference: As progressives and New Democrats, we agreed with the broad strokes of the Yale report.
mt: We agreed with the main thrust of the Yale report, as progressives and New Democrats.

source: Malheureusement, nous avons dû faire face à une très mauvaise communication du <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">ministre du Patrimoine canadien</Affiliation> qui a été, ma foi, incapable d'expliquer son projet de loi à moult reprises.
reference: Unfortunately, we had to deal with very bad communication from the <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4">Minister of Canadian Heritage</Affiliation>, who on numerous occasions could not for the life of him explain his own bill.
mt: Unfortunately, we had to deal with a very poor communication from the <Affiliation DbId="253406" Type="4"> Minister of Canadian Heritage</Affiliation> , who, I believe, was unable to explain his bill many times.

source: Il s'est fait attaquer, sous certains prétextes, par le Parti conservateur et il a été incapable de rassurer les gens et de continuer dans une direction constructive et positive pour ce projet de loi.
reference: He was attacked under various pretexts by the Conservative Party and was unable to reassure the public and to continue in a constructive and positive direction for this bill.
mt: It was attacked by the Conservative Party, under certain pretexts, and it was unable to reassure people and continue in a constructive and positive direction for this bill.

source: Monsieur le Président, je remercie ma collègue d'Edmonton—Strathcona et je lui réitère mes remerciements et mes félicitations pour tout le travail extraordinaire qu'elle a accompli au Comité permanent du patrimoine canadien sur ce dossier tellement important pour tant de Canadiens et de Québécois.
reference: Mr. Speaker, I thank my colleague from Edmonton—Strathcona and I want to reiterate my thanks and congratulations for all the extraordinary work she has done at the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage on this issue that is so important for both Canadians and Quebeckers.
mt: Mr. Speaker, I thank my colleague from Edmonton—Strathcona and I would like to reiterate my thanks and congratulations for all the extraordinary work she has done on this issue at the Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage, which is so important to so many Canadians and Quebeckers.

source: Comme à l'habitude, si un député d'un parti reconnu présent à la Chambre désire demander un vote par appel nominal ou que la motion soit adoptée avec dissidence, je l'invite à se lever et à l'indiquer à la présidence.
reference: In the usual way, if a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request either a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.
mt: As usual, if a member of a recognized party present in the House wishes to request a recorded division or that the motion be adopted on division, I invite them to rise and indicate it to the Chair.
